CrappyArray:CAInit01.label: CrappyArray init with number
CrappyArray:CAInit01.desc: Both the native Array and our CrappyArray can be initialized with a single number, which creates an array of the same number of undefined elements.
CrappyArray:CAInit01.testData:
object.length = 4
control.length = 4
subject
 contains , , , 
control contains , , ,

CrappyArray:CAInit02.label: CrappyArray init with list
CrappyArray:CAInit02.desc: Both the native Array and our CrappyArray are initialized with the same set of strings, yielding arrays containing those strings.
CrappyArray:CAInit02.testData:
subject.length = 4
control.length = 4
subject contains foo, bar, baz, quux
control contains foo, bar, baz, quux

CrappyArray:CAInit03.label: CrappyArray post-initialization
CrappyArray:CAInit03.desc: Create a CrappyArray and set its elements with the element method, doing the same with the native Array and the [] operator.
CrappyArray:CAInit03.testData:
subject.length = 4
control.length = 4
subject contains foo, bar, baz, quux
control contains foo, bar, baz, quux

CrappyArray:CALength.label: CrappyArray length read-only
CrappyArray:CALength.desc: The length property of native Arrays is read-only. You can try to set it, but it isn't changed. We're testing here to make sure that CrappyArray behaves the same way.
CrappyArray:CALength.testData:
BEFORE:

subject.length = 4
control.length = 4
subject contains foo, bar, baz, quux
control contains foo, bar, baz, quux


AFTER:

subject.length = 4
control.length = 6
subject contains foo, bar, baz, quux
control contains foo, bar, baz, quux, ,

CrappyArray:CAStackOps.label: Testing push/pop/unshift/shift
CrappyArray:CAStackOps.desc: We're looping through a randomized set of stack operations 50 times, looking for divergence between the subject and the control.

CrappyJSTest:CAMisc1.label: Pop/reverse bug check
CrappyJSTest:CAMisc1.desc: CrappyArray.pop has a bug in the handling of its length property, which in turn causes the reverse method to fail.

CrappyJSTest:CAMisc2.label: Default join separator
CrappyJSTest:CAMisc2.desc: Here we compare the behavior of Array.join and CrappyArray.join when no separator is specified.
